verses.text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-1/" title="Song of Solomon 6:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1  "JESUS_END"Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-2/" title="Song of Solomon 6:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2  "JESUS_END"My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
3 "JESUS_END"I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.
4 "JESUS_END"Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.
5 "JESUS_END"Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
6 "JESUS_END"Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
7 "JESUS_END"As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-8/" title="Song of Solomon 6:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

9 "JESUS_END"My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
10 "JESUS_END"Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?
11 "JESUS_END"I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
12 "JESUS_END"Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-13/" title="Song of Solomon 6:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13  "JESUS_END"Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
